Problem:
Consider a complex function \\( z(t) = h(t) + g(t)i \\), where \\( h(t) \\) and \\( g(t) \\) are real functions representing harmonic oscillations. We analyze the impact of a Fourier transform on this complex function over time t.

If the Fourier transform \\( \\mathcal{F}\\{z(t)\\} \\) is computed at t = 0, and then \\( z(t) \\) is allowed to evolve naturally over time, will the spectrum at time T reflect the initial conditions set by \\( z(0) \\)?
Explanation: The Fourier transform provides the frequency components of \\( z(t) \\) at t = 0. As the system evolves, these components do not change in frequency, though their phases and amplitudes might oscillate. Thus, the spectrum at any time T will reflect the initial conditions.
